stepTitle: The standard heats of formation, ∆H°f, are as follows: C2H4 (g) $$=$$ $$52.47$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$, H2 (g) $$=$$ $$0$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$, and C2H6 $$(g)=$$ $$-84.68$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$.
stepBody: Calculate the standard entropy change, ∆S°, for this reaction. Give your answer in J mol⁻¹ K⁻¹, rounded to $$2$$ decimal places.
